intro: Salsola pillansii, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer, adapting to high temperatures and low water availability. Salsola pillansii is well-suited to sandy and gravelly soils, making it a common species in desert environments. Its ability to thrive in harsh conditions makes it an important component of desert ecosystems.
